papers.abstract: With the rapid advances of RNA sequencing and microarray technologies in non-coding RNA (ncRNA) research, functional tools that perform enrichment analysis for ncRNAs are needed. On the one hand, because of the rapidly growing interest in circRNAs, snoRNAs, and piRNAs, it is essential to develop tools for enrichment analysis for these newly emerged ncRNAs. On the other hand, due to the key role of ncRNAs' interacting targets in the determination of their function, the interactions between ncRNA and its corresponding target should be fully considered in functional enrichment. Based on the ncRNA-mRNA/protein-function strategy, some tools have been developed to functionally analyze a single type of ncRNA (the majority focuses on miRNA); in addition, some tools adopt predicted target data and lead to only low-confidence results. Herein, an online tool named RNAenrich was developed to enable the comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis of ncRNAs. It is unique in (i) realizing the enrichment analysis for various RNA types in humans and mice, such as miRNA, lncRNA, circRNA, snoRNA, piRNA, and mRNA; (ii) extending the analysis by introducing millions of experimentally validated data of RNA-target interactions as a built-in database; and (iii) providing a comprehensive interacting network among various ncRNAs and targets to facilitate the mechanistic study of ncRNA function. Importantly, RNAenrich led to a more comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis in a COVID-19-related miRNA case, which was largely attributed to its coverage of comprehensive ncRNA-target interactions.

events.Text: With the rapid advances of RNA sequencing and microarray technologies in non-coding RNA (ncRNA) research, functional tools that perform enrichment analysis for ncRNAs are needed. On the one hand, because of the rapidly growing interest in circRNAs, snoRNAs, and piRNAs, it is essential to develop tools for enrichment analysis for these newly emerged ncRNAs. On the other hand, due to the key role of ncRNAs' interacting targets in the determination of their function, the interactions between ncRNA and its corresponding target should be fully considered in functional enrichment.

Primary Object: ability to analyze various ncRNA families
Secondary Object: interactions between ncRNA and its corresponding target

Context: increasing interest in circRNAs, snoRNAs, and piRNAs
Purpose: aid in discovering and classifying novel ncRNAs involved in diverse functions
Method: computational algorithms combined with bioinformatics platforms
Results: comprehensive analyses encompassing various ncRNA families including circRNAs, snoRNAs, and piRNAs
Analysis: statistical modeling and machine learning techniques applied to datasets from human tissues and cell lines
Challenge: dealing with noisy data inherent to biological samples
Implications: exploring uncharacterized ncRNAs associated with untapped disease pathways
potentially leading to groundbreaking medical breakthroughs

events.Text: Based on the ncRNA-mRNA/protein-function strategy, some tools have been developed to functionally analyze a single type of ncRNA (the majority focuses on miRNA); in addition, some tools adopt predicted target data and lead to only low-confidence results. Herein, an online tool named RNAenrich was developed to enable the comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis of ncRNAs. It is unique in (i) realizing the enrichment analysis for various RNA types in humans and mice, such as miRNA, lncRNA, circRNA, snoRNA, piRNA, and mRNA; (ii) extending the analysis by introducing millions of experimentally validated data of RNA-target interactions as a built-in database; and (iii) providing a comprehensive interacting network among various ncRNAs and targets to facilitate the mechanistic study of ncRNA function.

Secondary Object: a comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis of ncRNAs

Purpose: To develop an online tool named RNAenrich to enable the comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis of ncRNAs.
To realize the enrichment analysis for various RNA types in humans and mice
Method: Extending the analysis by introducing millions of experimentally validated data of RNA-target interactions as a built-in database;
Providing a comprehensive interacting network among various ncRNAs and targets to facilitate the mechanistic study of ncRNA function.
Results: It is unique in enabling the comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis of ncRNAs.
It has enabled the successful performance of multi-type analyses showing improved accuracy compared to prior methods.
Analysis: Analyzing the biological mechanisms behind the observed enrichments and interpreting other arguments.
Facilitating the mechanistic study of ncRNA function.
Challenge: Potential constraints or weaknesses including management of complex datasets and user interface design.
Ethical: Concerns regarding data privacy issues due to handling sensitive genomic information.
Justification or implication for addressing these issues.
Implications: BROADENING SIGNIFICANCE OR POTENTIAL FOR FUTURE APPLICATIONS/RESEARCH:

events.Text: Importantly, RNAenrich led to a more comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis in a COVID-19-related miRNA case, which was largely attributed to its coverage of comprehensive ncRNA-target interactions.

Primary Object: a more comprehensive and accurate enrichment analysis

Context: which was largely attributed to its coverage of comprehensive ncRNA-target interactions
Method: its coverage of comprehensive ncRNA-target interactions

papers.abstract: Native top-down proteomics (nTDP) integrates native mass spectrometry (nMS) with top-down proteomics (TDP) to provide comprehensive analysis of protein complexes together with proteoform identification and characterization. Despite significant advances in nMS and TDP software developments, a unified and user-friendly software package for analysis of nTDP data remains lacking. We have developed MASH Native to provide a unified solution for nTDP to process complex datasets with database searching capabilities in a user-friendly interface. MASH Native supports various data formats and incorporates multiple options for deconvolution, database searching, and spectral summing to provide a 'one-stop shop' for characterizing both native protein complexes and proteoforms.

events.Text: Native top-down proteomics (nTDP) integrates native mass spectrometry (nMS) with top-down proteomics (TDP) to provide comprehensive analysis of protein complexes together with proteoform identification and characterization. Despite significant advances in nMS and TDP software developments, a unified and user-friendly software package for analysis of nTDP data remains lacking.

We have developed MASH Native to provide a unified solution for nTDP to process complex datasets with database searching capabilities in a user-friendly interface. MASH Native supports various data formats and incorporates multiple options for deconvolution, database searching, and spectral summing to provide a 'one-stop shop' for characterizing both native protein complexes and proteoforms.

Purpose: to process complex datasets with database searching capabilities
Method: incorporate multiple options for deconvolution, database searching, and spectral summing
